image.altText: The rescue helicopter landed at Royal Darwin Hospital behind a fence.

props.synopsis: An aircraft has crashed in a remote part of the NT during a multinational military exercise, in which the pilot was ejected from the plane.

title.children: Aircraft crashes in remote NT during multinational military exercise

image.altText: Man with black hair in white t-shirt and grey hoodie stands on beach with waves crashing on rocks behind him on a sunny day

props.synopsis: A former financial planner who stole $3.3 million from his clients to fund his sports betting addiction writes to the prime minister from his prison cell, urging him to adopt the recommendations made by a parliamentary inquiry into online gambling harm.

title.children: Gavin stole millions and gambled it away. From behind bars, he's urging the PM to stand up to gambling companies

image.altText: A woman sits in a lounge room and stares into the camera.

props.synopsis: ASIC has launched an investigation into cold callers offering superannuation reviews. Those impacted say they felt pressured to switch superannuation providers.

title.children: 'They're a bunch of vultures': Cold callers offering superannuation reviews to be investigated by ASIC

image.altText: An effigy of Benjamin Netanyahu was walked through the streets around the US Capitol ahead of his address to Congress.

props.synopsis: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is met with thousands of protesters demanding his arrest during a visit to Washington, where he's pressing Congress to continue to support his war in Gaza.

title.children: Maggots at the Watergate and protesters in the street as Netanyahu addresses US Congress

image.altText: A man in a collared shirt, standing inside a venue, looking serious.

props.synopsis: The peak body for NT hospitality says police have used emergency powers to shut down venues for 48 hours with little evidence of wrongdoing.

title.children: Emergency police powers called into question after Alice Springs bars shut down

image.altText: Eddie Ockenden and Jess Fox with the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Jess Fox and Eddie Ockenden will have the honour of carrying the Australian flag at Saturday morning's opening ceremony on the Seine.

title.children: Fox, Ockenden named Australia's flag-bearers for Paris Olympics opening ceremony

image.altText: a mine site with a big truck and white rock

props.synopsis: After opening to much fanfare, Core Lithium has shut all operations at a Northern Territory mine and is cutting costs until it can get a higher price for its product.

title.children: Lithium miner goes from boom to bust in under two years but holds hope of revival

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The two sides of politics in Australia will slug it out over inflation, immigration and energy between now and the election — and both will be closely watching how these issues play out in the US.

title.children: Australian politics are less extreme than the US — but Albanese and Dutton can't ignore the parallels

image.altText: exterior of Darwin hospital

props.synopsis: A 36-year-old woman has died in hospital after an alleged public assault in Katherine, which police are describing as "a serious act of domestic violence".

title.children: NT woman dies in hospital after 'serious' domestic violence incident

image.altText: Passengers wait at Madrid airport while a screen shows the blue screen of death.

props.synopsis: The world's worst tech outage shocked many and exposed the underlying fragility of our networks, but for cybersecurity specialists it's merely a taste of things to come.

title.children: 'It's inevitable': Why global tech outages are the new normal — and are likely to get worse

image.altText: An aerial shot of the inner-city Perth suburb of Mount Hawthorn

props.synopsis: Australian housing prices continue to "defy expectations", rising for a sixth-straight quarter.

title.children: Australian property prices remain resilient despite economic headwinds

image.altText: A modern hotel room with a blue blanket on bed.

props.synopsis: More than one-third of adults in Australia are not getting the recommended amount of sleep per night. Now, the over-tired are the target of the multi-billion-dollar "sleep tourism" industry, which promises a good night's sleep — for a fee.

title.children: Sleep tourism is a multi-billion-dollar industry, and Australian hotels are jumping on the bandwagon

image.altText: CFMEU generic

props.synopsis: A senator who helped kill the building industry watchdog now says Labor needs a "stronger response" to the CFMEU scandal.

title.children: Labor told tougher cop on beat of construction sector needed after CFMEU scandal

image.altText: Wind turbines

props.synopsis: Big business urges Tanya Plibersek to avoid the temptation of a quick deal with the Greens over its proposed nature reforms, and instead work with the Coalition in reducing regulation of environment projects.

title.children: Proposed nature laws could stall wind and solar projects, business council warns

image.altText: Bags of light brown powder on a table next to a dirty weighing machine

props.synopsis: South Australian authorities issue a public warning after a highly toxic synthetic opioid more powerful than morphine was linked to seven fatal overdoses.

title.children: Authorities warn of a drug 'so potent' users are more likely to die before they get addicted

image.altText: A man performing a stunt with a mountain bike mid-air

props.synopsis: Australian BMX champion Logan Martin says he has had a "crazy start" to his Olympics trip, after his team's van was broken into on a Belgian street.

title.children: Australian cycling star has gear stolen day ahead of Olympics

image.altText: A composite photo of Kaylee McKeown Shayna Jack and Mollie O'Callaghan

props.synopsis: Australia's swimming team has been a veritable medal factory in recent Olympic Games and the expectation in Paris is no different. Here are the Aussie swimmers to watch.

title.children: From Titmus to McKeown — these are the Aussie swimmers carrying our golden hopes in Paris

image.altText: An elderly man in glasses and a cowboy hat stands in front of a rusted red background.

props.synopsis: Where Trump's unfinished wall ends on Jim's ranch you can simply walk across the border into Mexico. It's the centre of a political battle that will shape the US presidential election.

title.children: Mexican cartels smuggle drugs and people through gaps in Trump's border wall. Jim's had enough

image.altText: Three soldiers in uniform gather up colourful rubbish from the ground in the street

props.synopsis: The latest incident has some worried that North Korea could target specific sites with balloons carrying hazardous material, but experts are not convinced.

title.children: North Korean rubbish balloons hit South Korean presidential compound raising security fears

image.altText: Federation Peak north-west face conquered in winter

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old bushwalker missing in the Tasmanian wilderness died after a "significant fall" while attempting a mountainous peak where rescues are commonplace, police say.

title.children: Missing bushwalker's body found after 'significant fall' at Tasmania's Federation Peak

image.altText: IOC president Thomas Bach holds the board Salt Lake City after it was confirmed host of the 2034 Winter Olympics.

props.synopsis: For the second time, Salt Lake City will host the Winter Olympic Games following an IOC vote in Paris, while the 2030 edition is conditionally awarded to France.

title.children: 'We are back baby': Salt Lake City confirmed as 2034 Winter Olympic Games host

image.altText: A composite picture of LeBron James, Katie Ledecky and Noah Lyles

props.synopsis: There are more than 10,000 of the world's best athletes competing at the Paris Olympics. Here's a very short list of the internationals you should keep your eyes on when the action gets underway.

title.children: The biggest names and brightest international stars to watch at the Paris Olympics

image.altText: A plane strewn in bits

props.synopsis: The only survivor was the pilot, who was taken to Kathmandu Medical College Hospital for treatment, according to a doctor speaking to the Associated Press.

title.children: Plane crashes in Nepal's capital Kathmandu, killing at least 18

image.altText: A protester holds a placard reading 'stop killing students'

props.synopsis: Here's what has caused mass death, 2,500 arrests and a country of 171 million people to go without internet for almost a week.

title.children: Mass death, 2,500 arrests and almost 170 million offline: What you need to know about protests in Bangladesh

image.altText: Republican presidential nominee Trump holds a campaign rally with his running mate Vance for the first time, in Grand Rapids

props.synopsis: Since the end of the presidency of Barack Obama, who was 47 when he took his first oath of office, US politics has not only looked chaotic and unhinged, but tired and exhausted. American democracy has seemed more like an American gerontocracy.

title.children: Age will definitely be a factor in the US election. But maybe Oscar Wilde was right about the youth of America

image.altText: A woman holds a framed photo of another woman.

props.synopsis: Chrystalle had a history of self-harm and was diagnosed with borderline personality disorder. One day she presented to the local hospital but was left alone for too long.

title.children: Chrystalle asked her local hospital to keep her alive. She was offered tea and left alone to die

image.altText: The clasped feet of a ten-month-old baby boy on a blue rug.

props.synopsis: Economists are blaming cost of living pressures for plummeting birth rates, saying there's been a decline in baby numbers not seen since the 1970s.

title.children: Why the cost of living is leading to a decrease in Australia's birthrates

image.altText: A blonde boy in a blue hoodie looks on as a whale tips over a fishing boat.

props.synopsis: A video taken by 16-year-old Colin Yager shows the whale breaching, then flopping onto the rear of the boat as two men jump.

title.children: Video captures boaters being thrown into water as whale flips vessel

image.altText: Toutai Kefu arrives at the Supreme Court of Queensland in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Queensland's attorney-general lodges an appeal over the sentences given to two teenagers who attacked former rugby union great Toutai Kefu and his family in their Brisbane home.

title.children: Appeal lodged over teens sentencing after 'particularly heinous' robbery of Toutai Kefu's home

image.altText: The Eiffel Tower with the Olympic rings lit up in Paris

props.synopsis: Two Australian tech workers for Channel Nine have escaped serious injury after they were attacked in an attempted robbery in Paris on Monday.

title.children: Channel Nine Olympics staffers attacked in Paris as Australian police deployed

image.altText: Matt Dawson looks up and passes the ball

props.synopsis: Australian Kookaburras player Matt Dawson decided losing the top of his ring finger just two weeks out from the Paris Olympics was a price worth paying to appear at the Games.

title.children: Kookaburras in 'shock' after hockey star removes finger to play at Paris Games

image.altText: A large, yellow sun setting with a red sky.

props.synopsis: Preliminary data from the European Union's climate change service points to July 21 as the world's new hottest day since records began.

title.children: World sets new record for hottest day

image.altText: The rear of a boat made out of beer cans.

props.synopsis: Carefully crafted from the Wheatbelt's sturdiest tinnies, the SS Wyalkatchem is set to fly the flag for WA in the annual Darwin beer can regatta.

title.children: Boat made from 8,000 beer cans all set for 3,700km journey to Australia's Top End
